timeline.bodyText:
According to yesterday's discussion, we don't need the versionConstraint since it can be derived from the recipe file for each package. It can also lead to error cases, for example:
Deployment 1: Group A: pkgA-1.0 -> pkgD-2.0 (constraint: pkgD < 3.0) => resolved constraint: pkgD: < 3.0
Deployment 2: Group B: pkgB-1.0 -> pkgD-2.0 (constraint: pkgD > 1.0) => resolved constraint: pkgD: >1.0 && < 3.0
Deployment 3: Group A: pkgA-1.0 -> pkgD-3.0 (constraint: pkgD > 3.0) => constraint conflict!

In this case Deployment 3 will fail because the constraint brought by it conflicts with the existing constraint on device. However, in this case it shouldn't fail.
